intro: Coleocephalocereus estevesii, commonly known as the Estevés cactus, is a species native to Brazil. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its cylindrical stems covered in dense, white spines. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom during the summer months. It is a slow-growing cactus that thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in horticulture.
